You can manifest your psionic power as shimmering blades of psychic energy. As an object interaction you can manifest up to two psychic blades, one in each hand. These blades are magical simple melee weapons with the finesse, light, and thrown properties. The blades have a normal range of 60 feet and no long range, and on a hit, the main hand blade deal psychic damage equal to 1d6 plus the ability modifier you used for the attack roll, and the off hand blade deals psychic damage equal to 1d4 plus the ability modifier you use to for the attack roll. In addition, your psychic blades has the following Psychic Blade traits:

  • The damage dealt by attacks with your psychic blades becomes psychic damage and the attacks leave no marks or wounds on their target when they deal damage.
  • The blades vanishes at the end of your turn if you are not holdning them in your hand.
  • Thrown attacks at long range does not impose disadvantage on your ranged weapon attack rolls.
  • When you engage in two-weapon fighting, you can add your ability modifier to the damage of off-hand attacks if the off-hand attack is made with a psychic blade.

When you finish a long rest, you can infuse up to two daggers or longknifes with your psionic energy and turn them into psychic blades. When you do so, the blades gain the Psychic Blade traits, and you can manifest them when you manifest psychic blades. The infused weapons can be magical and you can have up to two infused psychic blade weapons at a time. If you attempt to infuse a third weapon, you must break the infusion with one of the other two. You cannot affect an artifact or a sentient weapon in this way.
